instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Had bad USB chip. Now getting 5V at all 4 ports. No 20V 

Power is reading 5V and around 300 mAmps.

Have enable on U6903 and 5V supply to it but only getting 3.1V out of it for PP3v3_G3H at pin 1 of L6900 and under 3V at pin 2 @ 2.8V.

Replace U6903? Voltage drop diode check of L6900 is .361V

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
300mA is too much current for 5V USB-C state.

Can we get the correct board code first?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Sorry about that. I changed the thread to 00281. I have 3 usb-C ports pulling 280 and occasionally and briefly 320mA. The fourth is pulling 80mA steady I believe the one that is corresponding to U3100. I changed U3200 as that port was not reporting any voltage/amps but now is at 5V.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings on LDO rails of each CD3215 chip.
Do you get 1V1 LDO at the chip corresponding to the powred port?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Ok. Thanks for the direction. Not sure why it didnt check the diode readings on the caps of the ports that were working... Anyway, U3100 had a couple of LDO caps shorted to nearly 0V. I pulled them to check if it was the caps but it was U3100. Changed it and went well and shorts were gone but I was drawing 0 amps. I swapped the chip again... same thing? I'm not understanding what's happened. The chip swap went very smoothly. Chips I have already had balls so all i had to do was clean pads and flux and solder on. I've rechecked the area to see if anything moved or chips gone or anything (even though I have zero reason to think anything happened) and not seeing or understanding a reason why I'm not drawing anything. Checked fuses near the CD3215's and they're all good.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Do you get 5V at R7020?
Also "Do you get 1V1 LDO at the chip corresponding to the powred port?"???
Check all them.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
5V at R7020 yes

i get pulse to 1v1 at UB 3/400. 
Nothing for 1v1 at 3100 or 3200

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
There is still a problem on U3100/200 area.
What is the current consumption on USB ports now?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Still zero amps at all ports

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: 3V3_G3H is there?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Yes 3v3_G3H present at 3.4V

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Recheck U3100/200 area; you must get 1V1 LDO.
Maybe new chips are fake.
Compare diode mode readings in different points between left and right ports.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Diode mode readings seem to be consistent on both sides for all 4 chips. Nothing unusual that I'm seeing. I change both 3100/3200 again testing between and still getting nothing at all for 1v1 LDO on that side. Diode readings from pin 35 is .485V drop red probe to ground. Parts were new from Beetstech.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Anything else outside of the CD3215 that could be causing 1V1 LDO not present?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: TBT ROM, U2890 for U3200.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Any possibility of reflashing U2890? :D
Would it have same file as ub090 that I could copy that one?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
It's a regular 25-series SPI ROM so it can be flashed like any other. It can be swapped from same model donor board and same side.
It's been observed on a 820-00928 that the dumps were different between each side. I don't know if copying one side to the other would work as intended.

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message:
Ahhhh. I figured that was a stretch. I guess I need some donors unless there's someone that might sell the files.

Not finding any donor boards with sides or even just the sides... dah

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: I have a working 2017 15" logic board with 4-USBC's. Any chance that USB firmware chip could be copied from same side of the board?

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: If you really can't find the correct firmware, you can try the 820-00928. I believe there are some small differences with the CD3215 circuit layout but it may not be a problem. I posted dumps here too: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-00840-a-stuck-on-5v-u2890-rom-firmware-required.60466/#post-68967[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00281 no 20V
threads.message: Nice. I thought I checked the forums maybe it was before that post... thanks!
